title: The Most Wonderful Time of the Year

options.text: As the urchins polish off '[i]O, Little Town of @@CAPITAL@@[/i]', the diminutive leader of the group hobbles forward on a crutch. "Beggin' yer leadership's pardon, but may I say I feels so gratified to see you an' yours all together. Whever a toff or an 'umble personage like me, Maxxmas is when fam'ly an' friends share goodwill an' 'appiness. Who needs posh gifts or a warm blanket — long as yer wiv fam'ly? You should tells people so, you know, in yer big Maxxmas speech."
options.result: happiness is all being miserable together

options.text: An urchin in a top hat and a slightly worn waistcoat steps forward. "But, as I say to me more hintimate friends, Maxxmas is a time for 'elpin' them of lesser means than meself. And, @@LEADER@@, if someone of your quality was seen givin' to good causes, your charitable nature would be an example to them that so esteem you." He rattles a donation tin.
options.result: most believe 'tis better to give than to receive

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: complete absence of social welfare
policiesAndNotabilities.name: complete absence of social welfare

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: devotion to social welfare
policiesAndNotabilities.name: devotion to social welfare

options.text: "Here, take it and go!" snaps the Minister of Big Business, dumping one @@CURRENCY@@ into the tin. "@@LEADER@@, darling, Maxxmas is a time for fabulous parties and finalising big plans. Talking of which, how about that investment in my department? Oh, I must have left the forecasts by the champagne fountain. Silly me!" [[color=blue]Alcohol is legal[/color]]
options.result: all work and no play makes parties very dull

options.text: "Here, take it and go!" snaps the Minister of Big Business, dumping one @@CURRENCY@@ into the tin. "@@LEADER@@, darling, Maxxmas is a time for fabulous parties and finalising big plans. Talking of which, how about that investment in my department? Oh, I must have left the forecasts by the champagne fountain. Silly me! Oh, come now — one treat won't break the ban..." [[color=red]Alcohol is illegal[/color]]
options.result: all work and no play makes parties very dull

options.text: "I'll tell you what Maxxmas is for," laughs your brother, seizing the urchins' donation tin and bolting the door. "Presents piled ten stories high, all with my name on them! Diamond-studded watches, cashmere suits, even a private helicopter! The one reason Maxxmas exists is to teach people that only present-buying is a true expression of love — an advertising campaign to remind them will get everyone shopping."
options.result: children asked by parents to 'guess how much I love you' ask for the cash value

options.text: "Talk about greed!" scoffs your uncle, who is currently hoarding a whole turkey for himself. "You don't need presents; Maxxmas is all about the big family dinner. A good one heals fractured families — the art must be taught in schools: that moist roast turkey... and crispy potatoes... and dessert..." He keels over, saliva forming a puddle. [[color=blue]Must not be vegetarian[/color]]

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: deadly medical pandemics
policiesAndNotabilities.name: deadly medical pandemics

options.text: "Talk about greed!" scoffs your uncle, who is currently hoarding a whole nut roast for himself. "You don't need presents; Maxxmas is all about the big family dinner. A good one heals fractured families — the art must be taught in schools: that rich savoury nut roast... and crispy potatoes... and dessert..." He keels over, saliva forming a puddle. [[color=red]Must be vegetarian[/color]]

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes removes notability: complete lack of public education
policiesAndNotabilities.name: complete lack of public education

policiesAndNotabilities.full: sometimes adds notability: deadly medical pandemics
policiesAndNotabilities.name: deadly medical pandemics

options.text: "Haven't we forgotten that Maxxmas is a religious holiday?" screams your niece. "We should celebrate the way that the early Order of Maxx did: by gathering in sackcloth and ashes, holding hands and silently condemning all displays of gaudy commercialism, self-indulgence and violence." [[color=blue]Must not be atheist[/color]]
options.result: Pater Maxxmas is said to deliver self-judgment rather than silver jewellery

options.text: "Shh!" hisses your aunt, covering your uncle's mouth with her hand. By her side sits a TV magazine with a series of films marked off: '[i]It's Too Soon for Maxxmas[/i]', '[i]I Can't Wait for Maxxmas[/i]', '[i]It's Finally Maxxmas[/i]' and '[i]Oh, Just Sod Off Maxxmas[/i]'. "This viewing gets better every year. This holiday would be far more restful if everyone stopped making a fuss and just grabbed a TV dinner and the remote."
options.result: Maxxmas is colloquially known as Zombie Day
